intro: Henckelia auriculata, commonly known as the auriculate henckelia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a distinctive auriculate (ear-like) base. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests.
